title: Tape Intervention R Script
text:
Food waste distribution
The distribution of food waste in the sample is as follows:
As the histograms below show, food waste is very right skewed with many 0s. The distribution is better after log transformation.


Show R script
ggplot(tall, aes(x = fw_g)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 20)+
  labs(title = "Histogram of food waste (g)")





Show R script
ggplot(tall, aes(x = fw_g_log)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = .2)  +
  labs(title = "Histogram of log transformed food waste")

title: Tape Intervention R Script
section: Habit of checking which food is near expiry
text:
Habit of checking which food is near expiry


Show R script
lme_stockhs <- lme(hs_stock ~ condition*time, random = ~1|id, data = tall3)
flextable(tidy(lme_stockhs)) %>% colformat_double(digits = 2)



effectgrouptermestimatestd.errordfstatisticp.valuefixed(Intercept)5.380.25151.0021.940.00fixedconditionintervention-0.930.3461.00-2.690.01fixedtimepost-0.280.23151.00-1.230.22fixedtimepost20.150.23151.000.650.51fixedtimepost30.200.25151.000.790.43fixedconditionintervention:timepost0.690.32151.002.140.03fixedconditionintervention:timepost20.510.34151.001.530.13fixedconditionintervention:timepost30.550.36151.001.540.13ran_parsidsd_(Intercept)1.04ran_parsResidualsd_Observation0.89


Show R script
emmeans_stockhs <- emmeans(lme_stockhs, specs = ~ condition | time)
contrasts_stockhs <- contrast(emmeans_stockhs, method = "pairwise", adjust = "tukey")
contrasts_time_stockhs <- contrast(emmeans_stockhs, method = "pairwise", by = "condition")
flextable(tidy(contrasts_time_stockhs)) %>% colformat_double(digits = 3)



conditiontermcontrastnull.valueestimatestd.errordfstatisticadj.p.valuecontroltimepre - post0.0000.2800.228151.0001.2280.610controltimepre - post20.000-0.1510.231151.000-0.6530.914controltimepre - post30.000-0.2010.254151.000-0.7940.857controltimepost - post20.000-0.4310.233151.000-1.8460.256controltimepost - post30.000-0.4810.255151.000-1.8900.237controltimepost2 - post30.000-0.0500.256151.000-0.1970.997interventiontimepre - post0.000-0.4130.231151.000-1.7900.282interventiontimepre - post20.000-0.6620.243151.000-2.7240.036interventiontimepre - post30.000-0.7540.254151.000-2.9690.018interventiontimepost - post20.000-0.2490.245151.000-1.0160.740interventiontimepost - post30.000-0.3410.256151.000-1.3320.544interventiontimepost2 - post30.000-0.0920.263151.000-0.3490.985


Show R script
flextable(tidy(contrasts_stockhs)) %>% colformat_double(digits = 3)



timetermcontrastnull.valueestimatestd.errordfstatisticp.valuepreconditioncontrol - intervention0.0000.9260.34461.0002.6920.009postconditioncontrol - intervention0.0000.2330.35161.0000.6630.510post2conditioncontrol - intervention0.0000.4140.36161.0001.1470.256post3conditioncontrol - intervention0.0000.3730.38361.0000.9730.335


Show R script
emmeans_stock_df <- as.data.frame(emmeans_stockhs)

ggplot(emmeans_stock_df, aes(x = time, y = emmean, color = condition, group = condition)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  geom_line(size = 1) +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = emmean - SE, ymax = emmean + SE), width = 0.2) +
  labs(title = "Estimated Marginal Means of habit strength of stock checking by Condition and Time",
       x = "Time",
       y = "Habit strength",
       color = "Condition") +
  theme_minimal()

title: Tape Intervention R Script

179 [0, 1800]









Descriptives
It looks like food waste is going down for the intervention group but not the control group.


Show R script
tall$time <- factor(tall$time)
tall3$time <- factor(tall3$time, levels = c(0,1,2,3), labels = c("pre", "post", "follow-up","final"))


tall %>% 
  group_by(condition, time) %>% 
  summarise(
    n=n(),
    mean=mean(fw_g),
    sd=sd(fw_g)
  ) %>% 
  mutate(se = sd/sqrt(n)) %>% 
  mutate(ci=se*qt((1-0.05)/2 + .5, n-1)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = time, y = mean, fill = condition)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "summary", fun = "mean", position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Food waste (g) over time by condition",
       x = "Time",
       y = "Food Waste (g)",
       fill = "Condition") +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size =16, family = "Arvo"),
        axis.title = element_text(size = 14, family = "TT Arial"),
        axis.text = element_text(size = 12, family = "TT Arial"),
        legend.title = element_text(size = 14, family = "TT Arial"),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 12, family = "TT Arial"),
        axis.line = element_line(colour = "darkgray", size = 1, linetype = "solid"),
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent"),
        panel.grid.major = element_line(size = .05, linetype = "solid", colour = "grey")) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0), limits = c(0,450)) +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel2")





Food waste over time by condition with 95% CI



Bar plots

But food waste always has a distribution with very many 0s and right-skew. However, the difference scores of food waste are normally distributed.


Show R script
ggplot(tall, aes(x = fw_g)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 20)+
  labs(title = "Histogram of food waste (g)")





Show R script
ggplot(tall, aes(x = fw_g_diff)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 40)+
  labs(title = "Histogram of food waste (g) difference scores")


Warning: Removed 63 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_bin()`).







Inferential statistics
if I just continue the analysis as is, using a mixed model, I get the following results.
A significant interaction for time*condition. And a significant decrease in food waste for the intervention group from pretest to the second post test.


Show R script
fw_lmer <- lmer(fw_g ~ condition*time + (1|id), data = tall)
flextable(Anova(fw_lmer, test.statistic = "F") %>% rownames_to_column(var = ".")) %>% colformat_double(digits = 3)



.FDfDf.resPr(>F)condition4.0531.00060.8140.049time1.7962.000110.8610.171condition:time3.1232.000110.9390.048


Show R script
fw_lmer_em <- emmeans(fw_lmer, specs = ~ condition | time)
cont_time <- contrast(fw_lmer_em, method = "pairwise", by = "condition")

flextable(tidy(cont_time)) %>% colformat_double(digits = 3)



conditiontermcontrastnull.valueestimatestd.errordfstatisticadj.p.valuecontroltimepre - post0.000-96.52355.147109.508-1.7500.191controltimepre - post20.000-20.72855.819109.856-0.3710.927controltimepost - post20.00075.79556.476110.2481.3420.375interventiontimepre - post0.00075.33855.942111.9401.3470.373interventiontimepre - post20.000149.99259.055113.2042.5400.033interventiontimepost - post20.00074.65459.449110.6741.2560.423


Show R script
fw_lmer_em_df <- as.data.frame(fw_lmer_em)

ggplot(fw_lmer_em_df, aes(x = time, y = emmean, color = condition, group = condition)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  geom_line(size = 1) +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = emmean - SE, ymax = emmean + SE), width = 0.2) +
  labs(title = "Estimated Marginal Means of fw_g by Condition and Time",
       x = "Time",
       y = "Food waste (g)",
       color = "Condition") +
  theme_minimal()


Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.





The main results for ANOVA are a bit different and these again differ from results of a RM ANOVA in SPSS. This one also has a significant interaction, but it is stronger.


Show R script
fw_aov <- anova_test(dv = fw_g, wid = id, within = time, between = condition, data = tall)
flextable(fw_aov$ANOVA) %>% colformat_double(digits = 3)



EffectDFnDFdFpp<.05gescondition1.00051.0003.1850.0800.049time2.000102.0002.9310.0580.010condition:time2.000102.0005.8180.004*0.020
